metadata.feature_description: Configure granular permissions for each workflow state

steps.action: Navigate to Settings > Workflow in persona bar
steps.expected: Workflows management page opens showing available workflows
steps.actual: Workflows page displayed with list of workflows including Content Approval, Direct Publish, Save Draft, etc.

steps.action: Click Edit (E) button on Ready For Review state in Content Approval workflow
steps.expected: Workflow State Edit dialog opens showing permission settings
steps.actual: Dialog opened showing State Name, Reviewers section with roles table (Administrators, All Users, Content Managers, Registered Users, Content Editors, Moderators), users table (SuperUser Account, Test Admin), Add User section, and notification options

steps.action: Select Community Manager from Select Role dropdown
steps.expected: Community Manager role is selected in dropdown

steps.action: Click Add button to add Community Manager role
steps.expected: Community Manager role is added to the Roles table with Review permission
steps.actual: Community Manager role appeared in the Roles table at the bottom with a checked Review checkbox and Delete action available

steps.action: View Users section in Workflow State Edit dialog
steps.expected: Users table shows users with Review permissions
steps.actual: Users table displayed showing SuperUser Account and Test Admin, both with Review checkboxes checked and Delete actions available

steps.action: Click Delete link on Community Manager role row
steps.expected: Community Manager role is removed from the Roles table
steps.actual: Community Manager role was removed from the table. The role is no longer visible in the Roles list and is now available again in the Select Role dropdown for adding

observations: Workflow State Permissions are accessed via Settings > Workflow in the persona bar, then clicking the Edit (E) button on individual workflow states, rather than through Module Settings as originally documented
The permissions grid supports both role-based and user-specific permissions with Review permission type
Administrator role has locked permissions (cannot be modified or deleted)
The UI supports adding roles from a dropdown filtered by role group
Users can be added via an autocomplete text input field
Notification options available: Notify Author and Reviewers, Notify Administrators of state changes
Code analysis confirms support for Allow/Deny permissions (SupportsDenyPermissions returns true), though UI primarily shows checkboxes for allow
